perturbation.changed_text:
(6)
Disputes: The parties shall first attempt to resolve any dispute related to this Agreement in an amicable manner by mediation
conducted in Phoenix, Arizona. The mediation shall take place no more than sixty (60) days after written notice from the party requesting
such mediation. Any disputes remaining unresolved after mediation shall be settled by a method mutually agreed upon by both parties.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit requirement for binding arbitration under AAA rules and replacing it with a vague 'mutually agreed upon by both parties' clause, the enforceability of arbitration is significantly reduced. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty in the dispute resolution process, undermining the original intent for a clear, binding arbitration agreement. Furthermore, this makes it difficult to enforce since any means can be argued.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Arbitration Act (FAA) may be undermined due to the ambiguity introduced.

perturbation.changed_text:
5.6
Withholdings and Taxes. Dr. Murray shall be responsible for all federal or state withholdings and taxes, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by EHS or EHN. Any indemnification of EHS or EHN for actions brought against them with respect to taxes will be subject to negotiation.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by EHS or EHN' introduces a loophole that contradicts the initial statement of Dr. Murray's responsibility for all withholdings and taxes. Similarly, making indemnification subject to negotiation creates uncertainty and reduces the enforceability of this clause. This shifts the burden of tax liability, a deviation from the original agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: IRS guidelines on independent contractor vs. employee classification.

perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE 8 -- NOTICES
All notices, communications, payments or other correspondence required to be given or made under this Agreement shall be in writing
and shall be deemed received (a) on the same day if delivered in person, courier service, confirmed e-mail delivery, or facsimile transmission, (b)
on the next day if delivered by next day Federal Express, UPS, or other reputable overnight carrier, or (c) within three (3) days if delivered by mail.
perturbation.changed_text:
ARTICLE 8 -- NOTICES
All notices, communications, payments or other correspondence required to be given or made under this Agreement are preferred to be given in writing but can also be delivered orally. Written notices shall be deemed received (a) on the same day if delivered in person, courier service, confirmed e-mail delivery, or facsimile transmission, (b)
on the next day if delivered by next day Federal Express, UPS, or other reputable overnight carrier, or (c) within three (3) days if delivered by mail.
perturbation.explanation: By adding that oral communication is acceptable, this reduces the traceability of information and conflicts the written nature of agreement. It's harder to prove it was said or to trace the intent of what was being said. Many jurisdictions prefer written evidence to be considered binding.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Statute of Frauds may be affected in jurisdictions requiring certain agreements to be in writing.
